Reviews.Title: a value under 400 dollars
Reviews.Author: Joseph Sullivan
Reviews.Content: I had an hp pavilion from 2007 and decided to stay with the line because of the four good years I got out of that hp computer.  I purchased this pavilion because it was(at the time) under 400 dollars.  Windows 8 takes some getting used to, but I haven't experienced many frustrations once I downloaded chrome.  Firefox and Internet Explorer did have some strange issues and once in a while took some time to open(which I think is a windows 8 issue) so I downloaded chrome, adobe flash, open office and have been using my new computer mostly hassle free.I would recommend this computer to anyone who is going on the internet, word processing, streaming videos, and saving pictures and movies.  I don't know if it's good for gaming or putting together videos.  I wouldn't pay the 450 or whatever price it is now for this computer due to some of the hardware limitations.

Reviews.Title: I call it my Cadillac Laptop.
Reviews.Author: leslie benjamin
Reviews.Content: This laptop is awesomely fast and terribly pretty to look at.  Plenty of  computer for a student or home office, with pretty good gaming capabilities too.  Boots up like lightning, shuts down without a bunch of questions, and never gets hot due to the HP cooling feature.  A little big for your lap on a bus, but I have a  small lap. lol Windows 8 has a glitch or two, but I think I like it and they stay on top of it, update-wise..  If you want something really familiar, go with XP or Windows 7.

Reviews.Title: Piece of garbage
Reviews.Author: Jon R. Stewart
Reviews.Content: This computer had issues right out of the box and kept getting worse until finally last week it just blue screened out and now won't function. I'm going to try a full system reboot, but if that doesn't work, it's going back, even if I don't get a full refund. I'll sink my money into a Dell or an Apple, instead.I was told HPs were better than Dells, but that's not the case with this laptop. Aside from all the problems with Windows 8, the touch pad on this always switched between hyper-responsive and non-responsive. Sometimes the system would boot quickly, sometimes super slow. I would get "high system use" warnings right out of the box, before anything was even processing. The Norton software that came with it worked sporadically, but wouldn't even finish a full scan most of the time.It's a lightweight and attractive design, but it stops there. I suppose it's possible I just got a lemon, but I've read other, similar complaints for this laptop. I got burned-- don't take a chance and get burned, too!

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This computer has been very reliable. The keyboard keys are a little small or shallow for fast typists. The touchpad keeps affecting typing. When you type, you might drag you thumb on the touchpad a bit. This moves the cursor sometimes which then changes the text insertion point. Result? Lots of typos that you have to go fix. Changing the touchpad sensitivity helps but it still happens a bit. Two fingered typists wouldn't notice.

Reviews.Title: Another Amazon Success story
Reviews.Author: Jkress
Reviews.Content: I am still new to trusting this whole buy from the internet.  The first HP had an issue right out of the box.  HP support said ship it right back.  The amazon return process made it extremely easy for even this novice.  But what mazed me wa sthe fact my replacement laptop was being shipped before i even had the old one back to the UPS store.  That impressed me.  The laptop was actually for my daughter who was in college and because they shipped it expressed, she got it on Monday with very little delay.  Anyone can sell stuff.  Its service after the sale that is hard to come by these days.  Amazon has my business as long as they continue to treat me this way.  This is my second very positive return experience this year.

Reviews.Title: HP Pavilion g6-2210us right laptop for the right price
Reviews.Author: Vern Kelly "Verno"
Reviews.Content: Bought this in November and has been very good as advertised. Selected this model because of the slightly bigger hard drive 640, USB 3 ports and still has a dvd read/write drive. I also wanted to go with Windows 8 since I had not upgraded since XP. Setup was very easy and Wi Fi connection worked with no problems. Windows Office is installed but not activated. Bought the activation code and Office installed with no problems.Windows 8 has pluses and minuses. It loads quickly and you can customize the Startup screen to your liking for quick access. The touch pad takes some getting used to and I do not like the first screen that comes up in Windows 8 that does nothing for you! I bought an HP printer 6510 e model (wireless) also through Amazon for a great price and it installed fine.I did have some crashes prior to the last Windows (never ending) updates that caused me some problems. I had the wireless printer working fine until I think I did an HP support assistant update when I lost direct printing. I did a painfully slow system restore to the day before and the computer is happy again. Really unsure what caused the problem in the first place.Also I do not care for the Windows Pictures App on the start page for importing pictures or for that matter looking at them. But there are plenty of other picture programs out there. Battery Life is good, audio is good and the performance is good. I like it! A backlit keyboard would be nice, but none of those models came close to the price of this one.

Reviews.Title: It is amazing.
Reviews.Author: allycepratt
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this product. My Hp is fast. The Windows 8 is a joy to work with. All of my educational needs are met. I love my Hp, watching movies online never felt soo good as well. :) You guys will enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Great computer.  runs smooth, looks beautiful, not heavy, fast, excellent keyboard, a lot of space to store music and pictures. My only major concern was windows 8 but after about 3 days use i can honestly say i prefer this os over windows 7. Would recommend giving this laptop a go, especially if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Nice Laptop
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: It is worth the money I spend on it. Windows 8 offers nicely new expeiece. Bright, easy to go with it.http://www.amazon.com/gp/offer-listing/B0090LNHEG/ref=dp_olp_new?ie=UTF8&condition;=new

Reviews.Title: Good computer
Reviews.Author: Tiffany D. White
Reviews.Content: I love the numeric keyboard on the right side, which makes data entry very easy. The computer was securely shipped and comes with step by step instructions for set up.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed!
Reviews.Author: G. Woessner
Reviews.Content: I have had the HP Pavillion g6-2210us for a week and am very frustrated.  The computer had problems initially loading Windows 8 and it took a couple tries.  Trying to get Microsoft Office full version loaded was a huge problem with many shutdowns, freezups and error messages.  I couldn't install the HP Help and spent hours trying to get help.  The online chat for Hp did not solve the problem and referred me to microsoft help because my laptop wouldn't install office even though it will also not install Hp automated helper (not sure if that is the correct name) or Hp updates.  I still have not worked out the installation problem.  My mouse arrow freezes often doing very simple tasks and it has shut down out of the blue...it even froze and shut down during an angry birds game. It will not recognize a usb plugin mouse.  And these are just the problems I have encountered in my first 4 uses.  I am so beyond frustrated.  I just want to use this laptop for basic use, nothing fancy.  I can only think that the particular laptop I received is defective because this cannot be normal!  I love the solidness of this laptop and the keyboard (although mine has a couple warped keys that I don't think is normal?!)  I do really like the mousepad texture and sensitivity.  At this point, I feel like I just wasted nearly 500 bucks and wish it was returnable.

Reviews.Title: A Terrible, Terrible Laptop
Reviews.Author: Keith Appleby
Reviews.Content: It is tough to say whether the problem is with the new Windows 8 or with the laptop, or how they interact. But. I have never ever had a laptop that was this broken right out of the bag. Constant system crashes, apps don't work, the mouse locks up, applications like firefox lock up for extended periods. Keep in mind, this is brand new, so the problem isn't a virus or system bloat. The laptop and OS arrive broken and incredibly slow.

Reviews.Title: Windows 8?  UGH
Reviews.Author: M. K. Bessey "Reading Rocks!"
Reviews.Content: I bought this after my six year old Dell crashed for about the 7th time.  I had two HP desk tops in my life and loved them both.  I really have no complaints about the computer.  The keyboard is a little flimsy but I love the 10 key addition for easy number entry.  The problem with this computer is the Windows 8 operating system.  It's really made for a touch screen net book, not a lap top.  The mouse pad is horrid and is constantly zooming in and out and adding "chiclets" to my screen or taking them away.  I can't attach photos to my e-mail, can't find anything I saved and that start up screen is a complete waste of time.  I'd recommend the computer ONLY if you could get a different operating system.  If I could get rid of it, I would.Since my initial review I have two additional complaints.  Six weeks after purchase, my sound card was gone.  Spent 45 minutes on the phone with HP trying to get it back.  Additionally, I was never able to play a CD, let alone burn one so it ended up with an IT guy just last week trying to address that issue.  I so wish I had purchased something else.

Reviews.Title: I liked what i saw...
Reviews.Author: IAmTheJudgeOfNoOne "ccyaltr"
Reviews.Content: I actually bought this for a friends daughter who was going to college, but I am a computer geek, so when I received it I wanted to check out Windows 8, get rid of software not needed, set up the updates and defragment schedule, and install Office 2010 and Norton Antivirus for her. I think the interface is made more for a touch screen and found myself going back to the classic desktop, but I can see the allure for the younger crowd, who have smart phones, liking it.  I have a 17" g70 and love it, so this one has a bit smaller screen but still has the number keypad, which I like very much.  I didn't get a chance to see if the battery lasted a long time or not.  I am the type that if the battery is charged and the computer is plugged into an outlet, I remove the battery like you are supposed to!  I would definitely recommend this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: <<<---<<(AZ)>>---...
Reviews.Content: This is a great laptop for the price. HDMI, full keyboard, it's quad core not dual core like tech specs says, memory expandable, screen bright and clear and the GPU works great on low and mid level gaming like Sim3 or Age of Empires 3, and the battery have a nice performance.I actually use it for some CAD design in Rhinoceros and im quite impressed how well Rhinoceros run in this machine. Im very satisfied with this laptop specially because was only 430$ (bought it on bestbuy) and Rhinoceros runs Great!- I have no CONS at all with this laptop, maybe its just annoying that some flash sites (youtube included) get laggy, but like always you get what u pay for, and for the price i think you get more in this case.- So to finish this review. If your budget for a laptop is BELOW the 500$ you can go with this for sure.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Deal!
Reviews.Author: douglas hoff
Reviews.Content: Showed up the next day! Everything was as expected.  Perfect packaging, as advertised, it was the best deal of my cyber monday.

Reviews.Title: g6
Reviews.Author: mike a.
Reviews.Content: HP no longer uses parts that will last for a person that uses a computer for more then internet use and at that not on a daily basis. Fans are not lasting.Motherboards are not lasting and the list goes on. Stick with dell or lenovo until hp decides to produce reliable products again. Search out replacement,keyboard,screen and such and you will see the staggering amount that are sold daily

Reviews.Title: Terrible product
Reviews.Author: M.
Reviews.Content: A sorry excuse for a computer.  So much hypersensitivity with the mouse pad that I no longer had any control as to which websites I visited - the computer would suddenly alternate between this webpage and that webpage with no input from me whatsoever.  And when I tried to call customer service to get some input on how to tone down the mouse pad sensitivity, I got someone from India who answered the call - I guess HP thought it was too expensive to hire an American for minimum wage - gotta pay someone 10 cents an hour because anything more than that will take too much profit from the top guys.  I will be taking this garbage back to the store ASAP tomorrow and getting a different brand.  Can't wait.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this thing
Reviews.Author: Michael Dvoskin
Reviews.Content: This computer is absolutely terrible.  I thought that I could figure it out and find ways to speed it up and for it to stop freezing, but unfortunately it is just awful and now I am outside of my window to return it.  Luckily it was cheap, so I can just by another.  Be very careful though, with this computer you get what you pay for.Note that this computer freezes within seconds of turning it on when the only open application I had was internet explorer (or google chrome or firefox) and I was just on ESPN.Com or a comparable site.  I switched antivirus protection programs, paid for a cleanup (which is ridiculous since it is only 2 months old) and nothing worked.  It's just a piece of crap.

Reviews.Title: Reasonably, very happy
Reviews.Author: Jacob Huelstrunk
Reviews.Content: 90% of my home computer usage dedicated to wasting time online. I was looking for an inexpensive replacement for my Dell Inspiron)1525 that I liked very much except for the fact that it kept breaking every three months (that's another story). I found the HP Pavillion g6 meets my needs very well. In a nutshell I like:- The cost (<$500)- The sound (Sound is better than on the dell)- Minimum of pre-loaded crap- I spend most of my time plugged in but battery life seems pretty decent.-  It has a separate numeric keypadOn the downside:- The display sucks compared to the Dell. Peripheral viewing drops off quickly. Overall barely acceptable.- Keyboard. Readability of the keyboard is poor, especially in low light. Keyboard feel is "chicletty" and cheapish.- Although it's perfectly adequate overall performance is not as good as the Dell. I'm not sure why, processor and memory are comparable. Probably Windows 8.Speaking of Windows 8, I was hesitant to buy a PC with Windows 8 preloaded. Windows Vista and I had reached a happy compromise and I wasn't looking forward to learning what all those tiles did. My fears were unfounded, I've drunk the Windows 8 kool aid. Although I spend 90% of my time using the desktop view I get the tile thing and see why they would be useful on a touchscreen tablet. I'm even considering replacing my old Android phone with a Windows phone at my next upgrade, just for the consistent user interface.In summary I'm very satisfied with my purchase. If I can go a year or two without breaking anything the HP will replace the Dell as the love of my latter day computer life.

Reviews.Title: Computer was junk
Reviews.Author: Angela Lopes
Reviews.Content: I brought the computer as an anniversary present to my husband. I was highly disappointed that the computer did not work properly. I will never order electronics from Amazon again.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: tasky46
Reviews.Content: But I am telling you that my experience has been AWFUL with HP. We bought a pretty expensive laptop a year and a half ago. 2 weeks after buying it the plastic broke off the front. A year after we bought it the built in mic and camera broke. CS hung up on me after hours of being transferred and on hold. Finally they said the warranty expired a few weeks earlier they couldn't help me. Now 1 and 1/2 years later our hard drive is dead. I bought a Dell in 2004 it is still running today. Please do no buy HP products. They DO NOT stand behind the quality of their products or value their customers.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop
Reviews.Author: BigBadWolf "Howl Often"
Reviews.Content: Got this for my wife when her old hp developed the "black screen problem".  She loves the boot speed of Windows 8.  It is only a few seconds to the desktop.  She did not like the Metro user interface face so I used Google search to find ways to give her a regular desktop.  It will do your basic tasks easily.  It works for her!

Reviews.Title: computer
Reviews.Author: karen
Reviews.Content: a great computer.i have had no problems with it at all.fast processing.very sharp and vivid screen.Love it! fast delivery.as well.

Reviews.Title: I purchased based on reviews
Reviews.Author: R. P. KROENING "Old Rocker"
Reviews.Content: However, I disregarded those complaints concerning Windows 8.  I find Windows 8 to be a refreshing upgrade to Windows XP (previously used system).  The computer itself seems well constructed, it charges quickly, and so far, setting it up with programs previously used has been a breeze.  Easy to see and read the screen.  My next project will be transferring files from the old to the new.  I hope that also works better than the reviews here have found, but I'm sure it will.  I've always been an owner of hp and / or Compaq and have always been highly satisfied with these products.  Updates will follow as time goes by

Reviews.Title: Fun
Reviews.Author: Sabrina Michael
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 takes some getting used to, but it's an awesome product. Plays movies as it should, has a good display, and not too loud. It's pretty good.

Reviews.Title: WOOOO
Reviews.Author: Connie Palacios
Reviews.Content: First time ever buying a computer on line, what a chance I took but everything was perfect, love my new comp a little different since it is a windows 8 it takes getting used to it but I love it.

Reviews.Title: Very Good pc
Reviews.Author: Ben Diaz
Reviews.Content: "It`s a great pc for the price, has a great resolution, is fast, doesn't freaze,  i'm very happy with it..."

Reviews.Title: not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: nizmo
Reviews.Content: baught it as a cheap laptop to take on the road with me . played world of warcraft plays it well at med settings for 5mans. for lfr groups need to turn it down to low . if you just need a laptop for web browsing and light gaming this is a pretty good deal . but if you can spring for the higher version with the a8 cpu that would be a better choice . and as for windows 8 ? takes a few to get use to . at first i was about to put windows 7 on it . but gave windows 8 a try for about a week and i love it . i may upgrade the ram to 8gig.

Reviews.Title: Laptop
Reviews.Author: Mario Roman
Reviews.Content: Its fast, and elegant the operating system is new to me but the more I use it the better I get at it.

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: T. Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grand daughter and she loves it.  Just what I expected and she will have lots of use for this in the next few years.

Reviews.Title: Very poor product/customer support
Reviews.Author: John Isaac
Reviews.Content: I purchased my HP computer with 2 year drop/spill warranty directly from HP. From past experiences with HP (HP pavilion dv9000), I knew that parts were likely to fail within the first two years (motherboard failed in 2nd year). Just outside of the first year, I was in a motorcycle accident and the computer took quite a hit. I broke the screen and I had to use my warranty. First time I called they told me I had no warranty and I spent over an hour proving I did. They assured me that they had resolved the problem. The computer was returned quickly, but only half of the problems were resolved (graphics card did not work on return). So I had to call again. I sat on hold for another hour while they told me that I didn't have a warranty for the second time, even though I could produce the service ticket from my last interaction with them. Even without the customer service experience, I haven't been impressed with the computer. It overheats regularly (needs a table fan blowing on it to run Guild Wars 2 without exceeding 100 degrees C). Overall, very disappointing in HP and their products.

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Medina
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop after my last one decided it no longer wanted to work anymore. It arrived a day early and it's been working great. My only issue is with the Windows 8, but that's not really something that affects the quality of the laptop itself. All in all, it's been good.

Reviews.Title: Very slow, unfortunately
Reviews.Author: anointedaughter
Reviews.Content: I like Hp but not this one. It has a slow processor with plenty of space but not enough for me to keep so we sent it back. It does not come with Microsoft Office or any other programs.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted for an affordable price!
Reviews.Author: Sahadeo Kangal
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter who needed a laptop for University. I found this to be a great laptop with all the features that are important and needed. I love the HD webcam and the easy to use keyboard. Screen is big and good to watch movies when your bored. It's a bit heavy, especially for my daughter but I guess it's to be expected with the size...still carrying around isn't so bad when you have a laptop bag. Furthermore, it runs smoothly and has a good feel to it. My daughter enjoys it and I must say it isn't a bad investment.

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves the laptop.
Reviews.Author: Bryan Rupp
Reviews.Content: We have not delved into the Windows 8 portion of the computer but she can do her homework and play games on the laptop like she wants.

Reviews.Title: Problems logging in
Reviews.Author: Lee H. McKnight
Reviews.Content: I still have problems entering the apps and Windows 8 system, perhaps because I am a computer dragon. I think that once I get accustomed to the programs, I will do as well as I did with Word Perfect and Window 3 and 7. Do you hear how old I am?

Reviews.Title: Very good laptop computer,
Reviews.Author: Olsen Barthelemy
Reviews.Content: I really like this computer, the design, the speed, the graphics and the system witch is windows 8.  The computer came as it was described and that makes me so happy.  The bad things it's because it came with aa antivirus trial, for 45 days only after all you have to purchase an other one.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Carelys Hernandez
Reviews.Content: buy this computer to work at home on my husband this happy is a very good computer, the only thing I would criticize is the package costs but rest everything else is very good.

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: Sam Tidman
Reviews.Content: It cant run all games like gta or saints row but it can run a lot of them pretty well but never perfect and it's hard to upgrade because its so small

Reviews.Title: Decent for the $
Reviews.Author: Sugar
Reviews.Content: I've had this laptop almost a year now, and it has been pretty good.  I'm no techie, but I use it a lot for photo editing, surfing the web, watching netflix, etc.  The only thing that worries me about it is that the AMD Display driver has crashed a few times but recovers within a few seconds.  It also is starting to run a little on the warmer side, even with the HP Cooling.. but I guess that is to be expected after a while.  Cannot use it for gaming, unfortunately.  Can just barely run any versions of Second Life (joke if you must), but I highly doubt this would be good enough to run something like WoW if it can't barely even run SL.  My CPU useage goes up to 95-100% when running SL (firestorm or linden labs) and nothing else.  All in all.. it's cheap, it's pretty dependable, and holds a lot of pictures and music.  I have well over 1,500 photos (most of them under 1mp) and a lot of music on here.  Skype on windows 8 is totally screwy for me.  Cannot find a desktop version of skype for windows 8 that runs very well.  For the money I spent on it.. I give it a 7 out of 10 for basic use.

Reviews.Title: this is crazy
Reviews.Author: Rudolph
Reviews.Content: What is this "low on memory" thing? i only have one browser open and this is supposed to be a 4gb ram.it keeps closing my browser and sometimes restarting my system all over again. it never stops. it freezes so easily. i am beginning to regret the purchase.

Reviews.Title: i would not recommend this computer
Reviews.Author: pogo86
Reviews.Content: i bought this computer to save some money, but i wish i hadn't this computer freezes and also i do not like the way the screen looks its a bit fuzzy for my taste

Reviews.Title: dont recccomend
Reviews.Author: Joseph M. Okitkun
Reviews.Content: within a month of purchasing this the fan stopped working. it's made of cheap plastic. i bought this for my little brother to use in his freshman year in HS, big mistake. I'd advise spending more money on a higher quality PC.

Reviews.Title: Good Laptop For Every Day Web Surfing
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I've had this laptop for almost two years now and so far It has been a decent laptop. I would Recommend this laptop to anyone who just wants a good laptop to do basic things on. You can render some short videos, run a few applications at once, skype, watch movies and do some gaming like older call of duty's or even skyrim on low settings. The issues I've had with this laptop are all pretty minor problems. My speakers are going out but I use headphones usually so that is not that big of an issue, I have a dead pixel and the screen doesn't seem as bright as it used to be. Also the camera is not very good. And again I've had this laptop for two years and it still runs great internally.Pros- Good key board, Fast, Reliable, Price.Cons-Speakers,Screen,Camera,Gets HotGet this laptop if you are looking for a cheap everyday web surfing laptop.

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: Shawn Smith
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cool birthday gift to give my wife. I came across this little beast. It packs good specs for a reasonable price for the non tech junkie like myself. Rich graphics and sound, lots of functionality. Definitely a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Gary Sherman
Reviews.Content: great PC at a great price. I bought this laptop for my granddaughters so they can do their homework w/o having to use their mother's PC. It has everything they need and along w/setting up parental controls I know that they'll be safe using it.

Reviews.Title: Very good value despite windows 8
Reviews.Author: wolfman7h "< ' | ' >"
Reviews.Content: I turned this machine over to a gifted middle school student who promptly put it to use exploring the world.  It has been running full tilt ever since. Good things:  It is still running after serious usage. It has most of the features we wanted. It is fast and neat in operation. the display is very good. memory is adequate.  Not so good things:  This machine likes to run hot, very hot.  I recommend a cooling mat.  Not a fan of "Tap Tap".  Besides the fact that it is loaded with windows 8 it is a good value and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Buy from another company.  You might as well flush your money down the toilet.
Reviews.Author: Jennie Dudziak
Reviews.Content: Your PC's are junk.  18months life on a laptop is a joke. The Pavillion had nothing but issues from the day I purchased it.  I had to send it in within 2 months of buying it.  Took a month to get it returned.  It always felt way to hot and I was worried that it could actually start a fire .  We are a family with five PC's in our home.  My husband also is the tech at a major corporation.  This is ridiculous.  I would recommend that you purchase another brand of PC from a company that stands behind there products.

Reviews.Title: good deal for the price
Reviews.Author: W. Holecek "Biz Traveler"
Reviews.Content: great deal for the money paid and the free windows 8.1 upgrade that improves the interface, its a good everyday lightweight laptop.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: Jayson
Reviews.Content: excellent love the laptop haven't given me any problems yet and works wonderfully. i would recommend this product to my friends

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Gilber
Reviews.Content: Excellent for office use! the hardware run on Windows 8 and no matter of the screen not been touch works great.

Reviews.Title: Worst Laptop
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Laptop for my brother in law. My bad i never returned the laptop or raised any complaint with in 30days of purchase as it started crashing often, over heated and finally when i send it to the HP service center they tell that this laptop cannot be servcied as this Motherboard chips are burned due to moisture content. They returned my laptop not serviced as it does not covers under the warrenty. Wrost service from HP AMS TCO Escalations Team aand they ask me to pay for the service even though it is still under warrenty period. For this I dont want to pay half the price of the laptop for service.

Reviews.Title: this sucks
Reviews.Author: mybuffie
Reviews.Content: REviews said it was easy to use and durable to transport. I hate it. It will not copy my address book so I have to use my old computer to send and respond to emails. you will be typing and it flicks to the map screen. I hate windows 8. It is the most user unfriendly program I have ever used. I have copied all my files from the other computers and when I try to pull them off the thumb drive it tells me I have to buy a program for $99 per year. That is crap and is not stated in the review.this computer is crap and I will never order another electro.nic component from Amazon. I will pay more for them and get them at Office Depot or Best Buy. I have never been so disappointed in anything I have ever bought from Amazon. The computer we bought from Sears is better than this one I researched. The Sears computer I did not..I will not buy anything HP again nor Windows programed. I am disgusted by this order and will never trust the name again.

Reviews.Title: HP Pavilion G6 Notebook
Reviews.Author: whippersnapper
Reviews.Content: I have had a remarkable experience with HP's service, and I am impressed.  They are TERRIFIC.  My machine arrived with a defective dvd drive.  I registered the machine before I realized this, which I now realize was a good thing.  HP's service is exemplary.  They promptly shipped me the replacement drive.  It is now installed, and  the machine is running very well.  I could have returned the machine for them to replace it, but I knew I could get this done, and it saved time. I am so pleased with my purchase and the service I received that I recommended HP to a family member who purchased one of their other machines.For the price this machine is exceptional.  I am not into games or graphics, so I can't comment on how it would perform in that category.  The USB3 ports are fast.  The machine has a comfortable keyboard and a good screen.Windows 8 hides things.  I have been told that their next update or upgrade (not sure which) will put the start menu back.  You have to poke around to find things.  Try right clicking in different places.  Menus change with small changes in the cursor location.  I uninstalled a lot of the stuff that was unnecessary and which was offers to buy stuff.  Windows 8 is not a bad program EXCEPT that it's hard to FIND things at first.  If you are determined, you can learn this program reasonably quickly, but I have been doing computers since Dos 3.11 before Windows was ever invented, so I do have a bit of an edge.  The aps page isn't bad, but I move to the regular desktop which is where I normally work from.  However, if you want to go back and forth from that to the aps page, it's easy to do and very helpful in many situations.Also in Windows 8, the right hand pop out menu changes depending on where you are, and from the aps page, if you move your cursor to the right to open the right pop out, then click on "tiles," you can tell it to open a bigger list of aps, and you can find a lot of the programs that do machine maintenance, etc.  However, if you are a beginner, be a little careful with those.  Also, you can find stuff in the programs directory from the file manager.HP HAS DONE SOMETHING WONDERFUL.  If you are a keyboard user and do a lot of typing, it is VERY handy that the touchpad can be turned  off with two light taps on a little indentation in the upper left corner of the touchpad.  Can be turned back on the same way, so you don't have to worry about what you are typing suddenly changing size or taking off into the wild blue yonder.  VERY handy.  Kudos to HP.The Windows 8 email program is horrible.  It seems to work well until you go to forward something, and then it gets messy.  As best I can figure out, you have to select what you want to forward, and that is like pouring molasses in January.  Then it doesn't always work.  When I tried to move something into a special folder, which should work, the machine froze.  If the email is open, and it seems to be open ALL the time, then I got an error message when I restarted the machine that windows couldn't access something.  That wasn't helpful, since the message disappeared so quickly I couldn't read it.  Without that email program set up, I don't get an error message.  Without the email program, the machine is working great.My suggestion is to delete all your email accounts, if you have set any up.  Use your email provider's web site, or, if you want to do your email on your machine, get a different program.  There are two reasons for this:  1. security  and 2. the program is lousy.About security, the very first thing I do when I turn on my machine is update my Norton's Internet Security.  If you have set up an account using the Windows 8 email program, you machine is online before you can get a security update, and you are not as fully protected as you should be if email comes in, as it almost surely will.I have already said the program drove me nuts, because it didn't work well.  I am perfectly happy working on the web site for my email, and that also avoids downloading a lot of spam and risking hostile files or viruses getting to your machine.  If you do use a machine based email system, I highly recommend Norton's security programs.  They have stopped bad emails from getting to my older machine, where I was using machine based email.  Obviously you have to do your own thinking about phishing emails, but Norton will stop hostile files and viruses fast.I hope this review helps people deciding whether or not to buy this machine.  It is an excellent machine for normal activities.  For running high end graphics, you need something bigger -- and more expensive -- but this machine is faster and does more than older desktops, and I like it a lot.If you have a problem, contact HP support.  They have a regular specified routine they go through, and if you will bear with them,they will help you as fast as they can.  Have a little patience, and they WILL solve your difficulties.  They certainly have done a wonderful job for me.  And it's not their fault you are frantic because you machine is pitching a hissy fit.Hope this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: youthminadam
Reviews.Content: I used to have dell thy broke twice for no reason and got this one and it's been work great and is excellent for school work.

Reviews.Title: gift to self
Reviews.Author: La Sana Groome
Reviews.Content: this was a great deal price and it works exceptionally well. i wish it automatically came with microsoft office though

Reviews.Title: New
Reviews.Author: Esther Berry
Reviews.Content: Not performing as I expected it too, having problems with it being to slow and unable to hold connection, not sure if its the computer it self or the windows program that is making it function poorly.

Reviews.Title: Runs like a champ...with the right software
Reviews.Author: Keith Livio
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a laptop with exact the specification that this laptop had...15 inch, larger keyboard, decent graphics (beyond the embedded) and the right cost, given we will be seeing next generation hardware come out at any moment. For the price, the hardware came through in spades. Lightweight, cool, easy on the hands. The software loaded, however, brings everything to a crawl. Though others may blame Windows 8 for this issue, its actually the complete nonsense that HP loads on top of Windows 8 that drags things down. My recommendation is to take your new laptop to the nearest IT geek, and ask them to reinstall the operating system before use. You can also try decrapifier, a program that will help scrub your system. Follow these steps, and your new HP laptop will zip along just fine.One note...if you are a Farmville fan, this laptop is not for you. The performance of the embedded farmville game in Facebook is miserable. I am still in shock that a web game will just not run on this hardware...look for laptops with higher end graphics form an embedded Nvidia card.

Reviews.Title: laptop lasted 45 days then kaput!
Reviews.Author: c  hernandez
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop it lasted 45 days then started overheating and freezing up! Customer service said the month expired -no support ! Save your money and  look elsewhere don't risk lemons!

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for the value
Reviews.Author: Les Stockett
Reviews.Content: It takes a while to get used to Windows 8 - will be better when the start buttonis returned in the new upgrade. As far as a computer, no complaints

Reviews.Title: GREAT LAPTOP
Reviews.Author: miltonbarahona
Reviews.Content: IT IS A COMPLETE LAPTOP, WINDOWS RANKING 4.9, WHY PAY MORE? AMD WORKS VERY WELL, GAMES SUCH CALL OF DUTTY MW3 RUNS VERY WELL.SOMTHING I  DONT LIKE IS WINDOWS 8, REALLY I DONT LIKE, AFFTER WARRANTY I WILL INSTALL WINDOWS 7.ALL LAPTOP IS OK, KEYBOARD, SCREEN, WEIGTH, BATTERY TIME,GREAT PERFOMANCE FOR THE PRICE.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Marcus House
Reviews.Content: The price is great but you get Garbage.  Within 1 week of buying I see that the keys on the keyboard stops working.  You will hit a J and it thinks you are trying to do F2 or screen swap.  The only way to get out of this is to log off and log back in.  The hot keys at the top of the keyboard are swapped.  So F5 does not do refresh.  I have never been able to successfully connect wirelessly with my printer.  Now after about 2 years, entire folders disappear.  What do I mean by that?  Well you can go to Windows Explorer (file manager) and you can go to your My documents folders and you can see your "Kids" folder (as an example) but if you write a word document and then go to save it, the "kids" folder within your My documents folder cannot be seen.  So what I have to do is save it to my desktop and then move it manually to the kids folder.  This also means that for the most part if I want to send an email with an attachment I need to save to the file to my desktop to ensure I will be able to find the file to attach to the email for sending.  I bought this laptop brand new and before this I had a Compaq Presario CQ60 that went bad a few short years after buying brand new.  I am really starting to think I should avoid all HP laptops all together.

Reviews.Title: it's okay
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Rainford
Reviews.Content: I find it to be reasonable dispute the start up takes a while at times and shutting down as well but, overall experience not bad to date.

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: Ivancho
Reviews.Content: I got totally pleased about this. I recommend it, on time like they said and everything was ok. Very good!

Reviews.Title: i love it!!!
Reviews.Author: carla washington-mclean
Reviews.Content: Still enjoying my HP laptop....there are so many features i did not even expect...love it!!!and i love most windows eight ....

Reviews.Title: I like
Reviews.Author: Glory
Reviews.Content: The hp Pavilion is a good buy but unlike the Asus, it gets hot. However it boots and resume quickly. It is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: HP Pavilion g6
Reviews.Author: Gary C. Jones
Reviews.Content: Pretty good Laptop in the under $400.00 price range. Good value. Windows 8 is a little confusing to work with but just switch to the desktop mode and windows works just like the former versions.

Reviews.Title: No issues or problems. Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Grudkitch "Aunty Bon"
Reviews.Content: This was super easy to use right out of the box. I have had it six months and I have been very happy with the performance of it. Even for a non techy person like me it is very easy.

Reviews.Title: nice lapto
Reviews.Author: texguy2010
Reviews.Content: This is my first laptop I have owned.It has been one week and no major issues.I did have an issue with wifi not connecting, so I did some research and found a fix and it has been day 2 and working fine. Another thing I was getting use to is windows 8 as I have owned , 98, xp, vista and windows 7.  My advice is to watch tutorials and actually try it out. Once you get the feel of windows 8 it's actually easy to navigate. This laptop is good for basics not gaming. Battery life is fair as It says 3.75 hours but I noticed 5 hour so I am not sure if this particular model was different. If you stream videos or music the the battery charge will go faster.  I will update you as often

Reviews.Title: Worst laptop on the market?
Reviews.Author: James Lyford
Reviews.Content: As a tech, I see a lot of computers, and very rarely do I see one so bad I must publicly shame it.  HP has been doing their best for years to taunt me into shaming them publicly, but until the G6 I have kept it under my hat.  Three of these have come in brand new with a host of issues, from sound not working, to freezing, to just failing entirely.  One of them we bought from the customer as part of a trade fora better computer; I figured I could use it as a rental for the shop.  I figured wrong, the first time it went out the door as a rental (with a brand new hard drive and OS reload) it stopped working within an hour or so.Stay away from this model, and HP in general until they get their crap together.On the brighter side, HP warranty service is very good, but that will not help you much with one of these computers.

Reviews.Title: very good but....
Reviews.Author: Odalis Sofia
Reviews.Content: excellent product, but is not on when the microsoft office. If you may solve this please, I need to use

Reviews.Title: two thumbs down
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: this product is horrible. there is poor sound quality and it shuts down at random times when you're using it. I would not buy this computer HP is definitely the way to go.

Reviews.Title: sending my order
Reviews.Author: LIRIA MENDEZ
Reviews.Content: rate them this way because I did order a month ago and has not yet come to hand, when I will send for directobox the amount to pay for the shipping of my lapto, plus I want it for this month, because delayed both by sending the packet.

Reviews.Title: Hate Hate Windows 8
Reviews.Author: Hate Hate Windows 8
Reviews.Content: Don't buy any computer with the Windows 8 operating system installed.  It was made for tablet-type products and is a complete, utter disaster for laptop and desktop applications.  I am a long-time heavy user of Windows products and, ironically, believe Windows 7 one of the best operating systems anywhere.  Windows 8 is more than frustrating, it is infuriating.  And don't think you can buy a computer with Windows 8 then just have Windows 7 installed as several close friends say this doesn't always work.  Your best bet is to buy a computer with Windows 7 already installed or go to Apple.

Reviews.Title: THE WORST!
Reviews.Author: Trevor Huskey "dog that is t"
Reviews.Content: I HATE THIS THING.  I will be another laptop after writing this review.  Windows 8 sucks.  If you by this, you will regret it.

Reviews.Title: nice laptop, but beware of Windows 8
Reviews.Author: Mark Arnesen
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice laptop computer, but Windows 8 really IS NOT configured for a laptop - IT SHOULD BE ONLY ON A TABLET!!!!!!!!!!! I have no idea why Microsoft felt they had to mess with Windows 7 on a laptop. I HATE Windows 8!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Excelente vendedor lo recomiendo 100%
Reviews.Author: gustavo alfredo lopez gonzalez
Reviews.Content: excelente vendedor lo recomiendo 100% muy confiable y responsable, el producto llego a mis mados en perfecto estado y el envio fue confiable

Reviews.Title: My review HP Pavilion g6-2210us
Reviews.Author: Robert Lewis
Reviews.Content: Love the computer, but not so crazy about Windows 8, taking a little getting used too. Using it do run my digetal music tribute show, dose a great job.

Reviews.Title: So far, soo good
Reviews.Author: Sai Emily Quiroga
Reviews.Content: I just got mine from Ciber Monday & I've liked so far! Windows 8 is totally new to me but the start window is fun & interactive, which as a designer myself I appreciate. I still haven't accessed internet to check out all the apps & haven't used it for my work though. I really hope it keeps being a good investment!

Reviews.Title: HP customer service fail
Reviews.Author: bellabella "bellabella"
Reviews.Content: I had many problems from the get-go.  I tried to get help from HP customer service and they told me straight out that I would have to pay $165 for a 1 yr warranty before they would help me.  Being already aggravated by this laptop, I flat out refused this huge fee.  If a company can't even stand by their product for a year without a warranty, then it is a not a quality product. Period.  It's just a cash-grap.  I have never had a company that said that to me before.  Basically I was having many problems with Windows 8 like programs not running properly.  One of the problems was the 'Microsoft Office'..pre-set (to download and install Microsoft Office), was not letting me use the free "OpenOffice" I downloaded to open documents (Microsoft conspiracy!).  Fine, I then tried to download trial version of Microsoft Office but still it failed after many many times.  That's when I called HP customer service and was told they wouldn't help unless I got the warranty.  Useless!  I did figure out if I uninstalled the Microsoft Office pre-sets, then the free OpenOffice would work.  I did that and it worked!  Amazing!  (to do this you press the Windows key + x.  A window will pop-up.  Go to 'Programs and Features' where you find the program and uninstall Microsoft Windows from there).  I would never buy from HP again and would not recommend this product because of HP customer service.  I am a small business owner and would never treat my clients this way.  Too big to fail???....hmmmmmmmm

Reviews.Title: Beautiful, Beautiful deals!
Reviews.Author: Cameron Cox "The One Who Lives"
Reviews.Content: Got this laptop off here for $306.99 with free shipping! Works amazingly too, it said it was used but it was in perfect condition and packaging and everything, windows 8 is pretty sweet too, love it! especially for the steal i got it at :D

Reviews.Title: I am loving this laptop!
Reviews.Author: Finesse Butler- Rahming
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift from my husband. He let me pick it out. I see that I made an excellent choice. The windows 8 OS makes you feel as if your operating a MAC and a PC in one. The features that came with the laptop are so useful. And the computer was in an excellent position.

Reviews.Title: Correcto
Reviews.Author: sudamericano_2011
Reviews.Content: El equipo llegó OK, funciona bien. Lo que me parece que es un poco chico para el Windows 8, al cual dicho sea de paso cuesta bastante adaptarse. Buena relación calidad precio.

Reviews.Title: Good Laptop
Reviews.Author: Eileen S
Reviews.Content: I can't talk about performace yet, because I only have two weeks with this laptop,(I don't live in USA) but I do can say that I love the numerical pad. Windows 8 is a little different, but not so difficult. The laptop Is very light. The screen is very brightly.

Reviews.Title: windows 8
Reviews.Author: Janet Sievers
Reviews.Content: I sent it back because I couldn't even begin to figure out how to use Windows 8.  But my friends tell me it was a good computer; just not for me.

Reviews.Title: Bum
Reviews.Author: arvetta
Reviews.Content: I thought this was touch screen and it is not would have like to have seen that written in the description. Other than that it came quickly and is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Popular one
Reviews.Author: shufengjue
Reviews.Content: 1. Store more files with the large hard drive on the HP Pavilion g6-2210us Notebook PC.2. Plus manage everyday tasks with the right speed and graphics.3. Count on the HP TrueVision HD Webcam when only a face-to-face conversation will do. Make a stylish statement with the HP Imprint finish in sparkling black.4. Also get automatic air conditioning for your HP Pavilion g6 laptop and protect data from accidental bumps and bruises using exclusive HP innovations.

Reviews.Title: good good
Reviews.Author: Miguel
Reviews.Content: really happy about my purchase. I bought two different laptops. I dont really want to wrtite this review, its kind of annoying at this time.

2.5GHz up to 3.0GHz AMD Dual-Core A4-4300M Accelerated Processor, Genuine Windows 8
15.6-inch diagonal HD BrightView LED-backlit display (1366x768),AMD Radeon HD 7420G Discrete-Class Graphics
4GB DDR3 SDRAM (1 DIMM)
640GB 5400RPM hard drive, SuperMulti DVD burner
HP TrueVision HD Webcam with integrated digital microphone, HDMI, USB3.0
